trans-unit.source: Represents a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> row.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> row represents a single data item in a bound data source.
Each row contains one cell per column in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid>, and each cell displays a single value in the bound data item.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref> class.
Gets the index of the row within a set of alternating rows.
Alternating rows are rows to which you can assign different characteristics, such as alternating background colors.

You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationCount%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> to indicate the number of rows within a set of alternating rows.
For more information about alternating rows, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Override the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.OnPropertyChanged%2A> method to respond to changes to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property does not have its own property changed method because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndexProperty> field reuses the read-only <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndexProperty?displayProperty=fullName> field.
The index of the row within a set of alternating rows.
The registered default is 0.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex"></xref> dependency property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndexProperty> field reuses the read-only <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndexProperty?displayProperty=fullName> field.
Arranges the content of the row.
The area that is available for the row.
The actual area used by the row.
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the details section of the row.
The template that is used to display the row details section or `null` to use the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.RowDetailsTemplate"></xref> setting.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.DetailsTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a template selector that provides custom logic for choosing a row details template.
A template selector for choosing the row details template.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.DetailsTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates when the details section of the row is displayed.
A value that specifies the visibility of the row details.
The registered default is <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility.Collapsed"></xref>.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.DetailsVisibility"></xref> dependency property.
Returns the index of the row's data item within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref>.
The index of the row's data item, or -1 if the item was not found.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref> that contains the specified element.
An element contained in a row to be found.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref> that contains the specified element.
Gets or sets an object that represents the row header contents.
The row header contents.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Header"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the row header.
To define a <xref:System.Windows.Style> for a row header, specify a <xref:System.Windows.Style.TargetType%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowHeader>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Style> can be applied to all row headers, or to an individual row header.

To apply a <xref:System.Windows.Style> to an individual header set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.HeaderStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.RowHeaderStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The style that is used when rendering the row header.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.HeaderStyle"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the row header.
The template that is used to display the row header or `null` to use the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.RowHeaderTemplate"></xref> setting.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.HeaderTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a template selector that provides custom logic for choosing a row header template.
A template selector for choosing the row header template.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.HeaderTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the row is in editing mode.
`true` if the row is in editing mode; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsEditing"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref> is a placeholder for a new item or for an item that has not been committed.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref> is a placeholder for a new item or for an item that has not been committed; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsNewItem"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the row is selected.
`true` if the row is selected; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsSelected"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the data item that the row represents.
The data item that the row represents.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Item"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the template that defines the panel that controls the layout of cells in the row.
The template that defines the panel to use for the layout of cells in the row.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.ItemsPanel"></xref> dependency property.
Called to update the displayed cells when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.Columns"></xref> collection has changed.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.Columns"></xref> collection.

The event data from the <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection`1.CollectionChanged"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.Columns"></xref> collection.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DataGridRowAutomationPeer"></xref> for this row.
A new automation peer for this row.
Called when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Header"></xref> property has changed.
The previous value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Header"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Header"></xref> property.
Updates the displayed cells when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Item"></xref> property value has changed.
The previous value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Item"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Item"></xref> property.
Invoked whenever the effective value of any dependency property on this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref> has been updated.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnPropertyChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The specific dependency property that changed is reported in the arguments parameter.
Override this method to respond to changes to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndex%2A> property does not have its own property changed method because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.AlternationIndexProperty> field reuses the read-only <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.AlternationIndexProperty?displayProperty=fullName> field.
The event data that describes the property that changed, as well as old and new values.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Selected"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsSelected"></xref> property value changes to `true`.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.OnSelected%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The event data, which is empty when this method is called by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref>.
Called whenever the control's template changes.
The old template.
The new template.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Unselected"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsSelected"></xref> property value changes to `false`.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.OnUnselected%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The event data, which is empty when this method is called by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow"></xref>.
Occurs when the row is selected.
This event occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsSelected%2A> property value changes to `true`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Selected"></xref> routed event.
Occurs when the row selection is cleared.
This event occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.IsSelected%2A> property value changes to `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.Unselected"></xref> routed event.
Gets or sets the template that is used to visually indicate an error in row validation.
The template that is used to visually indicate an error in row validation, or `null` to use the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.RowValidationErrorTemplate"></xref> setting.
The registered default is `null`.
For information about what can influence the value, see <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow.ValidationErrorTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
